meanings.definition: The act of dealing or negotiating with someone.
meanings.sent1: During the dealations, they discussed the terms of the agreement.
meanings.sent2: She was skilled in dealations and always found a fair compromise.
meanings.sent3: The dealations over who gets the last cookie became quite intense.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, dealations are like a strategic game of chess.
meanings.sent5: His talent for dealations made him a sought-after mediator.

meanings.definition: The process of distributing or apportioning something.
meanings.sent1: The dealations of resources among the team members were fair.
meanings.sent2: Dealations of tasks were necessary to ensure everyone had a role.
meanings.sent3: The dealations of candy at the party caused excitement among the kids.
meanings.sent4: In nature, dealations of sunlight determine where plants grow best.
meanings.sent5: The dealations of prizes at the event made everyone eager to participate.

meanings.definition: The act of handling or managing a situation.
meanings.sent1: Her dealations of the crisis were calm and effective.
meanings.sent2: Dealations of customer complaints were part of his daily routine.
meanings.sent3: The dealations of the surprise party kept her on her toes.
meanings.sent4: In a storm, dealations of the ship are crucial for safety.
meanings.sent5: His dealations of the project impressed his colleagues.
